column1: 10/10 - Great job identifying the product development team as a suitable function for implementing scrum/sprint methodologies and providing a clear explanation of how it could operate within that function. Keep up the good work!

8 pts - Missing significant explanatory content. 

Your response provides a general understanding of scrum/sprint and kanban methodologies, but it lacks specific details on how they could operate for the chosen Mighty Jaxx business functions.

7 pts - Some vagueness or incompleteness in discussion of fit.

Comment: Good attempt at explaining the poor fit of kanban, but it could be more specific to the function. Keep up the good work!

10/10

Great job identifying the supply chain management team as a business function that could benefit from implementing kanban methodologies. Your explanation of how kanban could operate for this function is clear and well-structured. Keep up the good work!
12 pts - Very complete and clear description of how kanban could operate. Great job explaining the benefits and process of implementing kanban for the supply chain management team.
8 pts - Complete and clear description of poor fit. Great job explaining why scrum/sprint may not be the best fit for the supply chain management team. Keep up the good work!

5 pts - Selected bias is clearly relevant to this situation

Great job identifying confirmation bias as a relevant issue for Jackson's decision-making process. Your suggestions for avoiding this bias are helpful and well-explained. Keep up the good work!

10/10

Great job! You provided a clear and accurate definition of confirmation bias and offered practical advice to avoid it. Keep up the good work!

Rating: 10/10

Comment: Good job on describing the potential benefits and challenges of implementing Agile methodologies. Just add a bit more detail on the specific steps to make it even better. Keep up the great work!
10/10 - Excellent job! You provided a clear and detailed description of possible steps and actions for implementing Agile methodologies at Mighty Jaxx. Keep up the great work!
